etymologies: early 19th century: from Greek phōs ‘light’+ -gen, with reference to its original production by the action of sunlight on chlorine and carbon monoxide

definitions: a colorless poisonous gas made by the reaction of chlorine and carbon monoxide. It was used as a poison gas, notably in World War I.

notes.text: Alternative name: carbonyl chloride; chemical formula: COCl₂

shortDefinitions: colourless poisonous gas made by reaction of chlorine and carbon dioxide
